text: Luo Ben (c. 1330–1400,Luo Guanzhong. Encyclopædia Britannica or c.1280–1360), also called Guanzhong (Mandarin pronunciation: ), was a Chinese novelist. He lived during the Ming dynasty. He is also known by his pseudonym Huhai Sanren ().Luo Guanzhong (2000). Sanguo yanyi: Three Kingdoms, 三國演義 [Romance of the Three Kingdoms]. Translated by Moss Roberts. Beijing: Foreign Languages Press, P31. Luo Guanzhong wrote the Romance of the Three Kingdoms. This book is one fo the Four Great Classical Novels of Chinese literature. == Images == == Related pages == * Romance of the Three Kingdoms, text that he probably wrote ==Bibliography== *Can Tang Wudai Shi Yanzhuan (残唐五代史演義, "The End of Tang Dynasty and the Period of the Five Dynasties") *Fenzhuang Lou (粉妝樓, "Cosmetical Building") *Romance of the Three Kingdoms *Sui Tang Zhizhuan (隋唐志傳) *Sui Tang Liangchao Zhizhuan (隋唐兩朝志傳, "The Chronicle of the Sui and Tang Dynasties) *The Three Sui Quash the Demons' Revolt (attributed) *Water Margin (editing) == References == === Citations === === Sources === * * * * ==Other websites== * * * * Andrew West, The Textual History of Sanguo Yanyi - Authorship Category:14th-century Chinese writers Category:Chinese novelists Category:People from Shanxi
